column1: At the beginning of the second millennium of the Third Age
column2: a mysterious being came to Amon Lanc in the south of Mirkwood
column3: and there built the stronghold known as Dol Guldur. This was the magician known as the Necromancer
column4: who was later revealed to be none other than Sauron himself
column5: and from his fortress tower a shadow of nightshade began to spread across the woodlands. From that time on
column6: the Elves came to refer to the Greenwood as Taur-nu-Fuin (Mirkwood)
column8: rendered into the Mannish tongue as Mirkwood.

column1: The story of Saurons darkening of Greenwood the Great mirrors events in the First Age
column2: when he occupied the highland forests of Dorthonion
column6: and was also known as Taur-nu-Fuin (Dorthonion).
